hero.title: Plant Explorer
hero.headline: Discover the world’s living library of plants
hero.subheadline: From Indigenous knowledge to modern science — trace the botanical stories that shaped medicine, ceremony, and culture. Explore, filter, and visualize 175 plants across continents.

visual.alt: Interactive world map showing botanical markers

intro.headline: Where Knowledge and Nature Intertwine
body: For millennia, Indigenous communities have cultivated deep relationships with plants — observing, naming, and transforming them into food, healing, and ritual.
Plant Explorer merges this wisdom with botanical research, creating a unified view of how ecosystems and human knowledge co‑evolve.

visual.alt: Panoramic transition across rainforest, savanna, and desert flora

interactive_layer.headline: Global Indigenous Plant Grid
interactive_layer.subheadline: An Interactive Map of Ancestral Knowledge
body: Navigate a data‑rich visualization of over 170 species.
Filter by region, tribe, ceremonial use, or active compound to uncover patterns that connect traditional knowledge and modern discovery.
interactive_layer.micro_stats_line: 175 total plants • 10 cultural regions • 70+ healing traditions

demo.alt: Looping animation of filters applied to plant grid

features.title: Cultural Context
features.text: Each plant entry honors the voices and traditions of its original custodians. Verified ethnobotanical data ensures authenticity and respect.

features.title: Scientific Insight
features.text: Cross‑referenced compounds and documented effects connect traditional remedies with current biomedical research.

features.title: Interactive Learning
features.text: Explore visual relationships between plants, regions, and uses — making Indigenous science accessible through intuitive design.

database_block.headline: Global Indigenous Plant Database
body: A searchable catalog that bridges storytelling and data.
Browse by plant name, use, or community of origin to explore the intertwined legacies of culture and biology.

closing.headline: From Ancient Roots to Future Growth
body: Plant Explorer is more than a reference — it’s a bridge between worlds.
By combining Indigenous wisdom with modern science, we rediscover the planet’s oldest knowledge system and reimagine sustainability through respect, reciprocity, and curiosity.
